data.name: Fried Rice
data.description: Indonesian fried rice made with a mix of ingredients including soy sauce and chicken.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan.
Sauté the shallots and garlic until fragrant.
Add the chicken and cook until done.
Add the rice and mix well.
Add sweet soy sauce, salt, and pepper to taste.
Cook until the rice is hot and the flavors are well mixed.
Serve with a fried egg on top.

data.name: Chicken Soto
data.description: Traditional Indonesian chicken soup with a mix of spices and herbs.
instructions: Boil the chicken until cooked, remove and shred.
Sauté the spice paste until fragrant.
Add lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, ginger, and turmeric, sauté briefly.
Add chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add shredded chicken, salt, and pepper, cook briefly.
Serve the soto with glass noodles, bean sprouts, boiled egg, lime, and chili sauce.

data.name: Beef Rendang
data.description: Indonesian slow-cooked beef in coconut milk and spices.
instructions: Cut beef into chunks.
Blend garlic, shallots, ginger, galangal, lemongrass, turmeric, coriander, and cumin into a paste.
Sauté the paste until fragrant.
Add beef, coconut milk, kaffir lime leaves, bay leaves, and chili.
Cook slowly on low heat until the beef is tender and the sauce is thickened.
Serve with rice.

data.name: Gado-Gado
data.description: Indonesian salad with a mix of boiled vegetables, eggs, tofu, and peanut sauce.
instructions: Boil the cabbage, bean sprouts, and green beans until cooked but still crisp.
Boil the potatoes until tender, then cut into chunks.
Fry the tofu and tempeh until golden brown.
Arrange the vegetables, potatoes, tofu, and tempeh on a plate.
Top with boiled egg and pour over the peanut sauce.
Garnish with fried shallots and a squeeze of lime.

data.name: Satay
data.description: Grilled skewered meat served with a savory peanut sauce.
instructions: Cut the meat into bite-sized pieces.
Marinate the meat with soy sauce, garlic, shallots, coriander, cumin, and turmeric for at least 1 hour.
Thread the meat onto skewers.
Grill the skewers until the meat is cooked through and slightly charred.
Serve with peanut sauce.
